filteredPostsExperience.title: My experiences working as a software developer üß™
filteredPostsExperience.description: In this experience section I tell about my professional career in world of software development.Through these posts, I share my experiences in different projects, teams and organizations, I talk about the technologies and methodologies that I have used, and, although I mention somewhat technical terms, my approach is more narrative to offer an overview of my path and learning...

filteredPostsOpinion.title: These are my opinions on things in the world of software development in general ü§î
filteredPostsOpinion.description: The Opinion section is more focused on expressing my 'thoughts' about the world of software development. I talk about a few news, trends, clean code, good practices, architectures and so on. Some of these topics are still beyond my control, so it is very likely that I will rely on experts (always leaving the credits to the person who shares their knowledge).

filteredPostsProjects.title: These are the projects I have been working on üë∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
filteredPostsProjects.description: In this section I present my personal projects in software development. They are projects that I have developed out of passion and curiosity, with the aim of learning and mastering new tools (or simply as a hobby). For example, creating administrative managers in Excel with VBA and then creating Bots using Python.

mainInfo.title: Information about the blog
mainInfo.description: In this blog, I f on sharing the latest updates about my projects, programming tips, and relevant industry information. Let's code, learn, and grow together! üí°üë®‚Äçüíª
mainInfo.callToAction: If you have any suggestions, don't hesitate to contact me!

social.title: Sebastian P√©rez's Social Media
social.paragraphOne: Although I don't post very often, you might find useful reposts or interesting information on my social media.
social.paragraphTwo: I often follow posts from leading figures in various technologies, mostly English-speaking, so you'll likely see a lot of posts in English.
social.acknowledgement: I have great respect for content creators who share their knowledge on social media and help the community improve. Also, thanks to those who comment to help others respectfully üíô.
social.thanks: Thank you for reaching the end of these recognitions
